org.osmdroid.tileprovider.modules

Class SqlTileWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.osmdroid.tileprovider.modules.SqlTileWriter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IFilesystemCache, SplashScreenable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SqlTileWriterExt

    public class SqlTileWriter
extends Object
implements IFilesystemCache, SplashScreenable
    An implementation of IFilesystemCache based on the original TileWriter. It writes tiles to a sqlite database cache. It supports expiration timestamps if provided by the server from which the tile was downloaded. Trimming of expired

    If the database exceeds Configuration#getInstance()#getTileFileSystemCacheTrimBytes() cache exceeds 600 Mb then it will be trimmed to 500 Mb by deleting files that expire first.

    Since:
    5.1
    See Also:
    DatabaseFileArchive, SqliteArchiveTileWriter

      • runCleanupOperation

        public void runCleanupOperation()
        this could be a long running operation, don't run on the UI thread unless necessary. This function prunes the database for old or expired tiles.
        Since:
        5.6

      • importFromFileCache

        public int[] importFromFileCache(boolean removeFromFileSystem)
        a helper method to import file system stored map tiles into the sql tile cache on successful import, the tiles are removed from the file system.

        This can take a long time, so consider running this off of the main thread.

        Returns:

      • runCleanupOperation

        public void runCleanupOperation(long pToBeDeleted,
                                int pBulkSize,
                                long pPauseMillis,
                                boolean pIncludeUnexpired)
        Parameters:
        pToBeDeleted - Amount of bytes to delete (as tile blob size)
        pBulkSize - Number of tiles to delete in bulk
        pPauseMillis - Pause between bulk actions, in order not to play it not aggressive on the CPU
        pIncludeUnexpired - Should we also delete tiles that are not expired?
        Since:
        6.0.2

      • delete

        public long delete(String pTileSourceName,
                   int pZoom,
                   Collection<Rect> pInclude,
                   Collection<Rect> pExclude)
        Delete cache tiles
        Parameters:
        pTileSourceName - the tile source name (possibly null)
        pZoom - the zoom level
        pInclude - a collection of bounding boxes to include (possibly null/empty)
        pExclude - a collection of bounding boxes to exclude (possibly null/empty)
        Returns:
        the number of corresponding tiles deleted from the cache, or -1 if a problem occurred
        Since:
